chain.description: Choose which network / blockchain to use.

chain.name: Chain
chain.description: Run this node on the given network.

testnet.name: Testnet
testnet.description: Run this node on the Bitcoin Test Network. Equivalent to -chain=test

regtest.name: Regtest
regtest.description: Run this node on its own independent test network. Equivalent to -chain=regtest

signet.name: Signet
signet.description: Use the signet chain. Equivalent to -chain=signet. Note that the network is defined by the -signetchallenge parameter

signetchallenge.name: Signet Challenge
signetchallenge.description: Blocks must satisfy the given script to be considered valid (only for signet networks)

signetseednode.name: Signet Seed Node
signetseednode.description: Specify a seed node for the signet network, in the hostname[:port] format, e.g. sig.net:1234 (may be used multiple times to specify multiple seed nodes)

vbparams.name: Version Bits Deployment Params
vbparams.description: Use given start/end times for specified version bits deployment. Regtest mode only, in format <deployment:start:end[:min_activation_height]>. Can be set multiple times.

app.description: Basic parameters regarding LND node operation.

datadir.name: Data Dir
datadir.description: The directory that lnd stores all wallet, chain, and channel related data

logdir.name: Log Dir
logdir.description: The directory that logs are stored in. The logs are auto-rotated by default. Rotated logs are compressed in place.

maxlogfiles.name: Max Log Files
maxlogfiles.description: Number of logfiles that the log rotation should keep. Setting it to 0 disables deletion of old log files.

maxlogfilesize.name: Max Log File Size
maxlogfilesize.description: Max log file size in MB before it is rotated.

acceptortimeout.name: Acceptor Timeout
acceptortimeout.description: Time after which an RPCAcceptor will time out and return false if it hasn't yet received a response.

tlscertpath.name: TLS Cert Path
tlscertpath.description: Path to TLS certificate for lnd's RPC and REST services.

tlskeypath.name: TLS Private Key Path
tlskeypath.description: Path to TLS private key for lnd's RPC and REST services.

tlsextraip.name: Tls Extra IP
tlsextraip.description: Adds an extra ip to the generated certificate. Setting multiple tlsextraip= entries is allowed.

tlsextradomain.name: Tls Extra domain
tlsextradomain.description: Adds an extra domain to the generate certificate. Setting multiple tlsextradomain= entries is allowed.

tlsautorefresh.name: Tls auto refresh
tlsautorefresh.description: The duration from generating the self signed certificate to the certificate expiry date. Valid time units are {s, m, h}. The below value is about 14 months (14 * 30 * 24 = 10080)

tlscertduration.name: Publish Hash Sequence Message High Water Mark
tlscertduration.description: If set, then all certs will automatically be refreshed if they're close to expiring, or if any parameters related to extra IPs or domains in the cert change.

tlsdisableautofill.name: Tls disable auto fill
tlsdisableautofill.description: Do not include the interface IPs or the system hostname in TLS certificate, use first --tlsextradomain as Common Name instead, if set.

externalhosts.name: External Hosts
externalhosts.description: A list of domains for lnd to periodically resolve, and advertise the resolved. IPs for the backing node. This is useful for users that only have a dynamic IP, or want to expose the node at a domain.

letsencryptdir.name: Lets encrypt dir
letsencryptdir.description: Lets the directory to store Let's Encrypt certificates within

letsencryptlisten.name: Lets encrypt listen
letsencryptlisten.description: The IP:port on which lnd will listen for Let's Encrypt challenges.

letsencryptdomain.name: Lets encrypt domain
letsencryptdomain.description: Request a Let's Encrypt certificate for this domain. Note that the certificate is only requested and stored when the first rpc connection comes in.

no-macaroons.name: No macaroons
no-macaroons.description: Disable macaroon authentication. Macaroons are used as bearer credentials to authenticate all RPC access

sync-freelist.name: Sync Fee List
sync-freelist.description: Enable free list syncing for the default bbolt database. This will decrease start up time, but can result in performance degradation for very large databases, and also result in higher memory usage. If "free list corruption" is detected, then this flag may resolve things.

adminmacaroonpath.name: Admin Macaroon Path
adminmacaroonpath.description: Path to write the admin macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist

readonlymacaroonpath.name: Read only macaroon
readonlymacaroonpath.description: Path to write the read-only macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist.

invoicemacaroonpath.name: invoice macaroon path
invoicemacaroonpath.description: Path to write the invoice macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist.

coin-selection-strategy.name: Coin Selection Strategy
coin-selection-strategy.description: The strategy to use for selecting coins for wallet transactions. Options are 'largest' and 'random'.

payments-expiration-grace-period.name: Payments expiration grace period
payments-expiration-grace-period.description: A period to wait before for closing channels with outgoing htlcs that have timed out and are a result of this nodes instead payment. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

listen.name: Listen
listen.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for p2p connections. One listen address per line.

nolisten.name: No Listen
nolisten.description: Disable listening for incoming p2p connections. This will override all listeners.

rpclisten.name: RPC Listen
rpclisten.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for gRPC connections. One listen address per line.

restlisten.name: REST Listen
restlisten.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for REST connections. One listen address per line.

restcors.name: REST CORS
restcors.description: A series of domains to allow cross origin access from. This controls the CORs policy of the REST RPC proxy.

externalip.name: External Ip
externalip.description: Adding an external IP will advertise your node to the network. This signals that your node is available to accept incoming channels. If you don't wish to advertise your node, this value doesn't need to be set.

nat.name: NAT
nat.description: Instead of explicitly stating your external IP address, you can also enable UPnP or NAT-PMP support on the daemon.

no-rest-tls.name: No REST TLS
no-rest-tls.description: Disable TLS for the REST API.

addpeer.name: Add Peer
addpeer.description: Specify peer(s) to connect to first.

ws-ping-interval.name: WS Ping Interval
ws-ping-interval.description: The ping interval for REST based WebSocket connections, set to 0 to disable sending ping messages from the server side. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

ws-pong-wait.name: WS Pong Wait
ws-pong-wait.description: The time we wait for a pong response message on REST based WebSocket connections before the connection is closed as inactive. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

minbackoff.name: Min Backoff
minbackoff.description: Shortest backoff when reconnecting to persistent peers. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

maxbackoff.name: Max Backoff
maxbackoff.description: Longest backoff when reconnecting to persistent peers. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

connectiontimeout.name: Connection Timeout
connectiontimeout.description: The timeout value for network connections in seconds, default to 120 seconds. Valid uints are {ms, s, m, h}.

debuglevel.name: Debug Level
debuglevel.description: Debug logging level. Valid levels are {trace, debug, info, warn, error, critical}

cpuprofile.name: CPU Profile
cpuprofile.description: Write CPU profile to the specified file.

profile.name: Profile
profile.description: Enable HTTP profiling on given port -- NOTE port must be between 1024 and 65536. The profile can be access at: http://localhost:<PORT>/debug/pprof/.

unsafe-replay.name: Unsafe Replay
unsafe-replay.description: Causes a link to replay the adds on its commitment txn after starting up, this enables testing of the sphinx replay logic.

maxpendingchannels.name: Max Pending Channels
maxpendingchannels.description: The maximum number of incoming pending channels permitted per peer.

backupfilepath.name: Backup file Path
backupfilepath.description: The target location of the channel backup file.

blockcachesize.name: Block Cache Size
blockcachesize.description: The maximum capacity of the block cache in bytes. Increasing this will result in more blocks being kept in memory but will increase performance when the same block is required multiple times.

feeurl.name: Fee Url
feeurl.description: Optional URL for external fee estimation. If no URL is specified, the method for fee estimation will depend on the chosen backend and network. Must be set for neutrino on mainnet.

nobootstrap.name: No Boot Strap
nobootstrap.description: If true, then automatic network bootstrapping will not be attempted. This means that your node won't attempt to automatically seek out peers on the network

noseedbackup.name: No Seed Backup
noseedbackup.description: If true, NO SEED WILL BE EXPOSED -- EVER, AND THE WALLET WILL BE ENCRYPTED USING THE DEFAULT PASSPHRASE. THIS FLAG IS ONLY FOR TESTING AND SHOULD NEVER BE USED ON MAINNET.

wallet-unlock-password-file.name: Wallet Unlock Password File
wallet-unlock-password-file.description:
The full path to a file (or pipe/device) that contains the password for 
;unlocking the wallet; if set, no unlocking through RPC is possible and lnd
; will exit if no wallet exists or the password is incorrect; if
; wallet-unlock-allow-create is also set then lnd will ignore this flag if no
; wallet exists and allow a wallet to be created through RPC.

wallet-unlock-allow-create.name: Wallet Unlock Allow Create
wallet-unlock-allow-create.description:
Don't fail with an error if wallet-unlock-password-file is set but no wallet
; exists yet. Not recommended for auto-provisioned or high-security systems
; because the wallet creation RPC is unauthenticated and an attacker could
; inject a seed while lnd is in that state.

reset-wallet-transactions.name: Reset Wallet Transactions
reset-wallet-transactions.description:
Removes all transaction history from the on-chain wallet on startup, forcing a
; full chain rescan starting at the wallet's birthday. Implements the same
; functionality as btcwallet's dropwtxmgr command. Should be set to false after
; successful execution to avoid rescanning on every restart of lnd.

minchansize.name: Minimum Channel Size
minchansize.description: The smallest channel size (in satoshis) that we should accept. Incoming channels smaller than this will be rejected, default value 20000.
